items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->

One of my sons really enjoys drawing, and he decided he wanted to draw one of my watches. He chose the cheapest watch in my collection, one of my Casio F-91W.

He drew that, then asked to draw another, of course he chose the most expensive watch in my collection. 😳
items.content_text: One of my sons really enjoys drawing, and he decided he wanted to draw one of my watches. He chose the cheapest watch in my collection, one of my Casio F-91W. He drew that, then asked to draw another, of course he chose the most expensive watch in my collection. 😳

items.content_html:
Are there any other people here who manage their blog and microblog separately? I’m still trying to work out what that’s gonna look like long term, but I have no plans to fold my main blog into Micro.blog.

If you keep them separate, what’s that workflow look like for you?
items.content_text:
Are there any other people here who manage their blog and microblog separately? I’m still trying to work out what that’s gonna look like long term, but I have no plans to fold my main blog into Micro.blog.

If you keep them separate, what’s that workflow look like for you?

items.content_html:
onemanandhisblog.com

Does it matter if Substack is in financial trouble?

Really interesting post by @adders about the potential demise of Substack. I know a couple of people who have made Substack their home on the web. It might be time to start looking for alternatives, folks. 😞
items.content_text:
[onemanandhisblog.com](https://onemanandhisblog.com/2023/03/does-it-matter-is-substack-is-in-trouble/)

> Does it matter if Substack is in financial trouble?

Really interesting post by [@adders](https://micro.blog/adders) about the potential demise of Substack. I know a couple of people who have made Substack their home on the web. It might be time to start looking for alternatives, folks. 😞

items.content_html: I’ve just been looking at the Apple passwords feature, since lots of people are talking about it at the moment (I’m a Bitwarden user) and it looks very good. I don’t think I’d use it though. I like the idea of having something like my passwords on its own service. Apple already have enough of my data, they don’t need passwords too.
items.content_text: I’ve just been looking at the Apple passwords feature, since lots of people are talking about it at the moment (I’m a Bitwarden user) and it looks very good. I don’t think I’d use it though. I like the idea of having something like my passwords on its own service. Apple already have enough of my data, they don’t need passwords too.

items.content_html: I’ve started wearing a fitness tracker (a Garmin Vivosmart 5, to be more accurate), but I already wear a traditional watch. So I have a watch on one wrist and the tracker on the other. It’s weird, but I’m getting used to it.
items.content_text: I've started wearing a fitness tracker (a Garmin Vivosmart 5, to be more accurate), but I already wear a traditional watch. So I have a watch on one wrist and the tracker on the other. It's weird, but I'm getting used to it.

items.content_html:
Since moving house back in October, it feels like all we’ve been doing is haemorrhaging money…around £40,000 so far to be exact!

We’re starting to see some progress now though, and I have to say, I’m very glad we moved. 😊
items.content_text:
Since moving house back in October, it feels like all we’ve been doing is haemorrhaging money…around £40,000 so far to be exact!

We’re starting to see some progress now though, and I have to say, I’m very glad we moved. 😊

items.content_html:
Jason Kottke celebrated 25 years of blogging yesterday that’s just incredible to me.

Incidentally, I celebrated 10 years of blogging myself recently.

Hurray for the personal blog! 🎉
items.content_text:
[Jason Kottke celebrated 25 years of blogging yesterday](https://kottke.org/23/03/kottke-is-25-years-old-today) that’s just incredible to me.

Incidentally, I celebrated [10 years of blogging](https://kevquirk.com/ten-years-of-blogging/) myself recently.

Hurray for the personal blog! 🎉

items.content_html:
bt.ht

Stop Using Custom Web Fonts

I’m not sure I agree with Brad here. Well, for the most part I do, but I have a font on my site, and I use it because I really like how it looks. That all, that’s the reason. 😊

I’ve also had a few people comment about the font, so some people clearly do appreciate custom fonts. Agree though, performance still needs to be a key factor.
items.content_text:
[bt.ht](https://bt.ht/webfonts)

> Stop Using Custom Web Fonts

I’m not sure I agree with Brad here. Well, for the most part I do, but I have a font on my site, and I use it because I really like how it looks. That all, that’s the reason. 😊

I’ve also had a few people comment about the font, so *some* people clearly do appreciate custom fonts. Agree though, performance still needs to be a key factor.

items.content_html:
I hear a lot of Americans saying “I went for a hike today…” in posts that are accompanied by often beautiful pictures of the US vast and varied landscape.

But what is “a hike” to your average American? Because to me (British), a hike is a 20 mile hike up a large hill/mountain. Is it the same?
items.content_text:
I hear a lot of Americans saying “I went for a hike today…” in posts that are accompanied by often beautiful pictures of the US vast and varied landscape.

But what is “a hike” to your average American? Because to me (British), a hike is a 20 mile hike up a large hill/mountain. Is it the same?
